justification: "Agreement to those statements was measured before ... on a 7-point Likert scale to capture participants' prior ... beliefs."
The text states that after the information search, "participants rated their belief about the topic statement again" using the same "7-point Likert scale."

measured_by: video-coded first card/category accessed in the information board
justification: "Each trial was videotaped and coded regarding the search start..." indicating that the initial piece of information opened on the board was coded from the video.

measured_by: video-coded count of information pieces examined
justification: The article notes that trials "were videotaped and coded regarding ... the amount of information searched," meaning coders counted how many cards participants turned over.

measured_by: difference between prior and posterior 7-point Likert ratings
justification: The authors "examined whether the presentation of information during the search process changed prior beliefs and analyzed belief revision," which was operationalized as the change between the two Likert-scale belief ratings.
